Reviews.Title: “Location is Key”
Reviews.Author: meanmarv
Reviews.Content: Located on the main land not Venice proper in Mestre the hotel was a challenge for our bus driver to find because the way the roads run. Once we found our location we shook off the disappointment of the pictures we saw versus the location of hotel entrance in a walking alley. The lobby pictures are very accurate. Old world style the General Manager and staff were eager to help. There was always an English speaking person at the desk 24 hours a day.Rooms were small but typical European style. Most people forget the room is just for sleeping as you are supposed to be out seeing the sites of Venice. The desk sells the ACTV Cards which you use for the bus to and water buses in Venice. The bus stop is just a short walk from hotel. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance of hotel along with more shopping where it appears the locals shop. Across the street is a multistory store within a super market in the basement level. the prices are very good and a great place to purchase bottled water. Locals also shop here and it is open on Sundays. If you have to have a large room I would request to see one before you book. This is a great value for location if you looking to balance costs against location. General Manager there since 1955 and can name all the State Capitals of USA.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Trouble-Free”
Reviews.Author: LiaSdiLuna
Reviews.Content: I had not planned to stay at Hotel Venezia and came upon it by mere chance because another hotel I had reserved was unacceptable. Hotel Venezia is apparently a family-run establishment, and I found its location, proximity to transportation, decor, and level of professional service to be well worth the 75 EUR per night. They offer a very adequate breakfast buffet with a lot of choices including coffee, tea, orange juice, yogurt, ham, cheeses, fresh breads, cereal, and so on. They also have a very elegant restaurant. Although I did not eat dinner there, I did look at the menu, and their selection was very good, and the prices were especially good. Our room was very nicely decorated, and I loved the small details, like the heated towel rack and ample space to store our luggage. Of course the foyer downstairs is absolutely beautiful, and no, the rooms do not maintain this frivolity, but are still clean, decorated, and relaxing. Had a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Venice”
Reviews.Author: KenixSokYee
Reviews.Content: Located in the center of Mestre, the heart of Venice is easily accessible. I absolutely loved this nicely located and well furbished three star hotel. It has a great combination of old-fashioned charm and utility. My room is quite compact and simply furnished with air conditioning, satellite tv, a safe, telephone, hair dryer and complimentary wi-fi connection. Continental breakfast was simple yet tasty and dinner was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: oneyeartraveller
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Venezia. It was good value for Venice and was very close to shopping and the bus route into Venice proper - approximately 15 minute ride. The food in the restaurant was some of the best we had in Venice. Would definitely recommend this if you don't want to stay in old Venice.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: DavidBonsai
Reviews.Content: Restaurant is very nice food very good, shopping mall and market just around the corner all so the staff was very help full, can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully old fashioned Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter202
Reviews.Content: When you stay in one of the hotels belonging to one of the large hotel groups, once you step through the door you could be in any city or any country, they are all the same. When you step through the door of the Venezia, you are in no doubt that you are in Italy, lots of gold coloured ornate architraves, statues, marble flooring and heavy rich curtains are everywhere. The dining room was exceptional as far as the furnishings and decor were concerned. The food, while not exceptional, was reasonable and good value. The service provided by the staff was good and helpful and helped us greatly to find our way around the area and Venice. The rooms, which were a reasonable size, were also furnished as per the rest of the hotel. The hotel which is located just off the main street, with no passing traffic was very quiet. All in all a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Two Ladies traveling italy”
Reviews.Author: Pamilla
Reviews.Content: Pros. 1. Room reminds you of a time in the 1940 2. Beds are comfortable 3. Bathroom clean 4. Restaurant breakfast is normal for europe 5. Bus is a 10-15 min walk Cons 1. Staff seem to be over worked and short tempered 2. Internet is hit or miss 3. Ants in rooms..we were on third floor?..... 4. Telephone did not work, but was qui k to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Mestre”
Reviews.Author: robs_bergen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite a distance from Mestre station. If you are a budget traveller then take a bus or tram ( tram station is a bit away from the central station) otherwise taxi (which I guess should not cost so much)..If you book this hotel through the hotel's website then you get free one way ticket to the Venice Island.. Breakfast was good.. And the staffs were extraordinarily fluent in English (compared to the Italian Standard).. I will of course stay at this hotel again if I do not have a lot of luggage..

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: beckga
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights with extended family taking in three different rooms. While the service of the staff was always polite and efficient, this place needs cleaning!!! Two of the rooms where OK in size, however my sister and I were given a room off the property that was a postage stamp size in every aspect! Our feet were black from filthy carpets, the linen was not changed, and my parents had to sleep with their bathroom door shut as it smelled of urine! We had a mix up in our first reservations and this hotel could take all of us, otherwise we would not have stayed there! Neither should you!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting decor- good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mikki_Glass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting Venice. The bus stop to get to the island is right around the corner, so it was fairly convenient. The room was small but clean. The breakfast was good. The decor is pretty interesting- lots of shiny gold everywhere. Look for the blue hottub in the smoking area of the dining room (which is closed off). There is free internet, but you may have to sit in the stairwell to get service (we did).

Reviews.Title: “next to mestre center!”
Reviews.Author: peps1
Reviews.Content: old fashioned but nice hotel to stay and visit venice and it is next to the center fo mestre to walk around, shopping, restaurants, bars!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: belmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the final night of a touring holiday, although reception area is all very nice the rooms are tiny, had to leave our suitcases at side of the bed as nowhere else for them. Shower was a wet room with extremely slippy tiles and cotton cloths for towels although I have seen these supplied before in Italy. Bar closed around 11.30pm. Breakfast had very little choice, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaA
Reviews.Content: Ugly lobby, horrible breakfast, small rooms. The only plus is its price, but it is a full of kitsch three star hotel, uglier that Romanian hotels. I never thought that in Italy the breakfast could be made of low price ham and tastless cheese. Never ever stay there again. Only the wonderful Italian light in the morning was able to make my day better.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, not so clean, I wouldn't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: amy221
Reviews.Content: Very Very tacky decor (pink,red dated and dirty) perhaps in a Russian? style? It is so garish that it is disturbing. Usually I am not that picky about decor, but in this case...well! Rooms small and dirty, but the bathrooms while very very! small are clean and updated (but they are hard to use they are so small, basically toilet and shower and sink with a drain in the middle (so everything gets wet)- I would say 4 by 6 at most in size. Restaurant is over priced and service is rude, food is so-so. There are basically no restaurants in the area since it is a residential area, so if you don't want to get stuck at the hotel, plan in advance! The only places to eat are more snack type places or bars. The town square is lovely and it is a really nice residential area, nice shopping and a great farmers market daily. The hotel is in a good location and not far from the bus stop to Venice (about a 10-15 min ride)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in customer service”
Reviews.Author: TNSandy
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Venezia because of its relative proximity to Venice and the lower rates than what are available in Venice. Upon arrival, we were given a brochure with detailed information on how to get to Venice. Unfortunately, the bus system routes had been updated and the Hotel was still providing outdated material. We followed the instructions to get to Venice and had no problems. For our return, we followed the instructions and were dumped by the bus line in an area many miles from our hotel. We do not speak Italian, do not know how to operate the pay phones in Italy, and could not tell anyone where we were. After help from a young lady at a store at the bus stop, we got a taxi back to the hotel. It cost 25 euros in taxi fare and would have been more if we had not had someone to share the fare with. Hotel management would not accept any blame for handing out incorrect information and refused to reduce our bill at all. By the way, they continue to hand out incorrect information.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Damsal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing its advertisement on the internet. It was close to Mestre station and close to transport to Venice. The bus to Venice was a street away and it was a 15-20 minute bus trip to Venice. This we were happy about. The hotel advertisement showed a glitzy, expensive looking foyer which it does have but unfortunately that's where it ended. We had booked for 2 nights with a group of friends. We all paid similar internet prices but received varying standards of rooms. Our room was a reasonable sized room on the third floor, comfortable bed, comfortable room, tiny bathroom with shower that wet everything in the room (shower curtain no shower cubicle) even though our voucher said bath. On our return to Venice 10 days later just as a couple we were given a room on the 6th floor. It was tiny, not very appealing, very dated and uninviting. Even tinier bathroom. Paid same price per night as our first visit. The air conditioning was not effective so we kept the window and shutters open all night to get some air. The curtains were sheer so the lights from the busy Mestre streets kept the room very bright all night. The rooms on this floor also allowed noise from the hallway and other rooms into our room to the point that I was woken throughout the night thinking that someone was tryin g to get into our room - it was the next door guests going into their rooms. The bed was 2 single beds pushed together, with separate mattresses, sagging in the middle of each single bed. When we looked under the bed we found what looked like camp stretchers - not great for a romantic getaway in Venice. Breakfast initially had the appearance of being great but was very basic and just OK. The staff, while helpful when asked about directions etc, gave the appearance that we were a nuisance and were stopping them from getting on with other more important jobs. We were just being tolerated. Not a warm, friendly welcome, no service with a smile. We would not be hurrying back to this hotel and wouldnot recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away: Far and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: S_H_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through expedia as it was one of the close hotels to the main train station "Mastre" ... it took us about 1.5 hours to walk from Mestre Station to it! (very disappointing) ... When we reached the Hotel, we found the reception very unfriendly and rude. They asked for our passports and they refused to return them! They said they have to keep them till the evening... So we had to risk traveling to Venice, the islands, without passport as we were staying for one night. Although we booked a none-smoking room on a high floor, we were assigned a smoking room on level one. The room was so small that we did not know where to fit the bags. We had a double bed as was requested, but the actual bed had two single mattresses side by side!!! which was pointless for a double bed! They did not have towels in the bathroom rather than plain cloths and no mini bar. Finally the advertised full breakfast consisted of 1 choice of cheese, 2 choice of cold meet, 1 choice of serial, milk, coffee and cordial (not 100% juice)... nothing for vegetarians This hotel only meets a 3 star standard with it's price (not the facilities)! it costs about 10 euro for a taxi from this Hotel to Mastre station. Train takes another 15 minutes to Venice (the islands). There is a "Sardine Can" bus near the hotel that goes to Venice that takes 20 minutes. whatever rate you get, add 10 euro taxi to get to Mastre station & 10 euro to come back + time + traveling from Mastre to Venice ... you do the maths! It is not worth it .. stay away (Better to book near "Santa Lucia" station as it is located on the islands!)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary_Walsh
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel pretty easily; it cost us about 10 eurosâ€™ from the closest train station (Venezia Mestre). When we arrived, (about half an hour early), it seemed a huge problem to the staff to check in early, or even to leave our bags, but we finally did get an early check in. Once in our room, we were pretty disappointed. The room was VERY dated, the carpets were stained, and the beds were very uncomfortable. We did get A/C, which was a blessing, as it was extremely hot outside. The bathroom was clean, but very small. Whenever we went to the desk for help, we were made to feel stupid WHEN someone would actually talk to us. More than once, we were made to wait a few minutes to talk to someone standing there doing nothing at all. Every question seemed a huge problem. We did not find this hostility at any other Italian hotel during our stay (we have been to Italy twice now). Breakfast was pretty good, but just a standard continental breakfast (no hot food). We don't recommend eating in the restaurant for dinner, the prices were expensive. Getting to the main area of Venice is easily done, via a 15 minute bus ride just at the end of the road. Easily the worst hotel we've stayed at in Italy. We will definitely not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller42
Reviews.Content: A nice surprise to arrive at the hotel to find it better than I was expecting. Staff were helpful and spoke excellent english. Room was nice and we were on the 6th Floor with an outside balcony with table and chairs. Bathroom was nice but the shower was an issue as the pressure and the right temperature hard to maintain. The hotel is situated in a nice part of town with the local area good for shopping and eating out. All in all a great place and a good spot for transport links to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: e-magdi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a very good location, centre of Venice is easily accessible by public transport, while you can leave your car in hotel's parking lot (for free). Breakfast was OK, with a wide selection. The room and the bathroom was very very small, but was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed (3) nights in Venice Mestre at this hotel. The hotel was nice and very clean. The breakfast is included and the rates are great. There is a great shopping area across the street and some of the best pizza you will ever eat in your life around the corner that unfortunately I cannot remember the name of but I do know it starts with an E and it is the only in this area. We took the train to Old Venice and it was only $1.00 each way. We loved staying in Mestre becasue it wasn't as touristy and we were more immersed in the local culture. You can also get the bus to Old Venice right outside of the hotel (bus 4 or 4/, both will get you there).

Reviews.Title: “Good value option in Mestre”
Reviews.Author: ericezza
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day trip to Venice with my girlfriend and would really recommend the Hotel Venezia for anybody who is happy to stay in Mestre - on the mainland just across the lagoon from Venice itself. Ou room was cosy and comfortable, the hotel staff were very helpful and it was very well-placed both for Treviso airport and Venice itself. You need the XXVI Ottobre (Mestre) stop using the Ryanair Eurobus from Treviso airport (do just make it clear to the driver you want to go there as it is not used by many people and some might ignore it). The Hotel is 50m from the busstop and clearly signposted. We paid just 82Euro per night for our room which is much cheaper than any of the options in Venice itself. Our room was comfortable and breakfast (continental style) was nice enough. The trip to Venice takes about 20mins on the bus from the same bustop 50m from the Hotel (take the number 4 or 4/ to Piazalle Roma bus station in Venice which is at the top of the Grand Canal nr the train station). A Venice travel card (10.5Euro for 24hours or 22Euro for 72hours) is valid for the bus, so you can go back and forward from Venice to the hotel as many times as you want without extra cost (we tended to travel in during the day, come back to get changed and then go back into Venice at night). We never waited any more than 15mins for a bus to/from Mestre. The buses back from Venice run all night and are always very busy and safe as they transport the musicians, waiters, shop assistants etc who work in Venice, but live in Mestre. Before we went everything we heard about Mestre was bad, but we had absolutely no problem. There is a shopping centre (BarChe) with a supermarket right opposite the Hotel and a lovely town square with shops and restaurants 5mins walk away. To get back to Treviso airport we took the bus into Venice just to make sure the Ryanair transfer did not ignore us, but that was no real inconvenience. Overall I would say Hotel Venezia is a great choice for anyone wanting to go to Venice on a budget as the city is very expensive in terms of accommodation.
